title: I just can't

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
This is so anti fun, I just can't do it, the enemy team all ways is filled with people with previous experience steam rolling anything that moves while every one on my team (especially me) is Dead weight, worthless.

I think the game has potential to be fun but, its not fun being completely overwhelmed by players that have twice not just your skill but the skill of your whole team combined. LoL Geranimo is the PERFECT example of this. hes a twitch streamer that basically says "Watch me, I will teach you how to get challenger"  Why am I bringing this up? well, He makes like a new account every month just to steam roll anything that moves till he is where he belongs, in the highest possible bracket any one can achieve Why does he need a new account, on top of the possibly hundreds he all ready has.

How are we supposed to beat some one like this? who has the game figured out on a molecular level(as far as I can tell).  hes not even a professional, but, for what he is he could very easily be if he wanted too. so, why is this allowed to happen in a competitive game, I can understand like a free for all mode but, this is not free for all.

In all likely hood I will stop playing all together. its too frustrating the constant insults and harassment from players you never stood even a remote chance against but, that makes it so much worse, they can't just leave it at "you have been slain" they have to  make sure you know you are a pathetic degenerate incapable of comprehending a carbon molecule. It never makes sense I wouldn't mind it so much if I had a similar chance to fight back but, I honestly don't   me being a stereotype doesn't help.  everything is made so much worse when your team is right there in the same boat too decides to make you a target of harassment as well.

replies.body: You built a death cap on Soraka followed by a sheen, and wonder why you got steamrolled?
...Ok, I was on a team full of bots the most recent game was a bit better but, I had to assemble a role I could help carry with to hopefully counter balance the robot trios.

Hey, I'm sorry you've had such unpleasant experiences in league :(

But I give you my word that the game does get better if you keep at it!

Pre level 30 can potentially be a rough time I know, because it is the division that has the most variety of skill levels. Some players _(like myself when I first joined)_ are completely new to mobas _(or in my case, competitive online gaming in general)_ and are learning not only how to play this game in particular, but how to play this whole genre of game, while other players are long time Dota veterans just switching over to League. This coupled with good players making new accounts like you talked about, does create the potential for an unpleasant experience, as much as I wish it wasn't true, it does happen. 

However, the more you play the game, the more the system can correctly judge your playing, and place you with and against players of your skill level. The longer you stick at it, the less and less you get put in games with people that steamroll the game. 
And the system works! I am telling the truth, it just needs a little time. :)

I agree that toxicity and insults are a big problem!
but Insults are an inevitable part of any competitive scene, and while they are indeed horrible to have in your game, you do build up a resistance to it. You'll soon be laughing inside at the people who insult you, as like all bullies, they are just sad inside and feel the need to prove to themselves that they are good players by making out like you are bad. 

My advice would be to use the add friend option to add people who you enjoy playing with to your friends list, and when you start a game, see if they want to play as well. 
Having a friend or two play with you enhances the fun of the game greatly, wether they are a real life friend or an online one. 

_______

I sincerely urge you to not give up on league yet.
Its a fun game that so many enjoy, it has amazing characters and backstories, and excluding some toxic players, the community is actually quite positive.

Not long ago there was a Secret Santa here on the boards _(completely community driven)_ where players gifted each other purely in the spirit of Christmas. Thats the type of community that league can have, and I have seen nothing like it in any other game, and the population of the boards is only a fraction of players in the game, so theres a lot of great players out there, don't let a few bad eggs spoil the fun you could have. 

Starting out is always frustrating, in whatever you do.
but keep giving it a go, I'm confident you will enjoy the game once you get going a bit more :)

its not the fact I lost, its the fact I never even stood a chance to make matters worse, they have to be mean about it. I am a dark souls Veteran I am used to dying a lot.

I am still very new, there are so many items and so many rules I have to get used too especially while trying to compete with players that are quite literally worth ten of me.  Its like, if you wanted to learn how to fight so, you picked a fight with some professional MMA dude. so, I see this impossible wall of pain and suffering and I don't want to get to max level.

truth be told, I do not want to play 1,000 losing games with toxic people that don't understand I barely started and the robot games are a complete joke. I hope what you said is true though, I hope it gets better. Starting to get tired of trying to save every ones butt.
No offence but That is the possible worst build for soraka it in effect makes her practically useless
then how did I get so many kills and carry my mostly robot team mates?
the hell are you talking about? I was 30/4/29 & 17/3/33?

Oh ok I see, the match history doesn't update from there I guess. I did some ARAM games after that and got some pretty insane scores. well, I didn't know what to do in the game you're talking about. What could I have done? only player on the team that ment anything was the blind fold guy and he was kind of a dick. what should I have done? every one was dying myself included. No one was doing damage.

Step 1
Using ur hard earned ip buy syndra (doesn't matter if u have never been mid before)

Step 2
Get some runes and masteries

Step 3
carry the game harder then that fed twitch because u are playing the most broken champion in the game :P
that could take literally forever. I don't think she is the most broken ether.
If you want someone to queue with to balance things out a bit I'm happy to help. Can't promise I'm on anywhere near as much as I used to be though.

Judging from the statistics you alone probably can't do much. No offence but, I don't think these players are bad, I think they are at the higher end of the ladder. and I don't want to win, I want a fair shot at winning.
Just keep playing and it'll eventually get better, it's fun to feed and be useless, just meme it out.

Its not "losing" I mind its being completely side stepped by players that have been playing for the past 8 years when I just created my first account they are treating me like I am some high level player who should know better when in reality I just started out not too long ago.
